attributes.action: Allow Councils to decide the amount of Hunting they want to allow.
attributes.background: The Hunting Act of 2004 and the Protection of Wild Mammals Act (Scotland) of 2002, ban the Hunting of wild mammals with dogs. There are arguments for and against this bill, but there is a large amount of people who want it repealed and a large amount of people who want it strengthened.
attributes.additional_details: Why not allow local councils to vote whether to keep the ban as it, weaken it slightly, strengthen it, or outright repeal it, this would be a way for local democracy in this country to help those who feel passionately on both sides. This could allow councils in rural areas that are against the ban, to show this and would allow councils in areas where people are passionately for the ban to strengthen the ban to levels they find acceptable?

attributes.action: Urgently Review current legislation on Oil&Gas developments near major Airports.
attributes.background:
With the news out recently regarding Horse Hill and the flow testing of their well of which has produced flows of conventional oil, it's apparent that the legislation needs to be reviewed urgently.
This well is just over a mile from Gatwick airport and clearly this is a concern if it was developed.
attributes.additional_details: Listed companies that are investors in HorseHill developments Ltd the licence holder of the well, have recently realised RNS's confirming flow rates of Oil and clearly this projects is likely to be developed over time and the current laws and regs do not reflect this advancement and their are concerns regarding safety considering this well and any future (possibly hundreds) wells are within a very short distance from a major airport (gatwick) oil storage tanks and airplanes don't mix.

attributes.action: Ban publicly accountable bodies from buying through 'middlemen' companies.
attributes.background: public sector buying organisations should not be able to outsource to larger private companies/buying platforms when dealing with small business. This only enriches the middlemen, prevents barriers to small business and will not produce public savings or improve quality of services.
attributes.additional_details: The North East Procurement Organisation (NEPO) representing twelve local authorities and others such as Sanctuary Housing group has appointed a single private company called NEPRO which small business must trade through. This outsources responsibility to a private company, prices will rise to pay the middlemen, public money will not be saved. It is another barrier to small business trading with government. It is also bad practice as the middlemen can control trade and who gets opportunities.

attributes.action: Rethink the way in which employment and support allowance is examined
attributes.background: Employment support allowance medical assessments are only done once at 14 weeks - things can change medically so they need doing more than once - they are also not robust enough
attributes.additional_details: I have several disabilities and illnesses myself and have been placed in the work category yet I am unable to hold down a job

attributes.action: Create a law that babies born prison should live with other relatives
attributes.background: Babies who are born in prison can't help it and should be moved to other relatives or adopted.
attributes.additional_details: Actually what inspired me may sound really cheesy, but it was Aerosmith's cover of Give Peace A Chance, with Sierra Leone's all-star refugees saying we shouldn't punish the kids for what they never did. Just like whether someone is black, or white, or Asian or whatever, they can't help it. And neither are kids who are born in prisons. Adults who go to prison KNOW why they're there and it's because they've done wrong (90% of the time), so I'm calling on David Cameron to create a law which means babies born in UK prisons are immediately taken out to live with other relatives in a stable loving home, or if needs be, adopted/fostered.

attributes.action: Limit council tax exemption to students housed in purpose built accommodation.
attributes.background: When Coventry planning committee agree another student accommodation development they quote that this will return a good number of current "student houses" back to use as family homes. To encourage this only students in purpose built multiple occupation properties should be exempt from council tax.

attributes.action: Make competition in the water industry as we currently have for gas and electric
attributes.background: Competition in the gas and electricity market has been in force for over 15 years however the water industry remains an uncompetitive market whereby a consumer has no choice over who supplies their clean water and who deals with waste water.
attributes.additional_details: Gas and electricity is an open market allowing a consumer to switch supplier for cheaper rates relatively easy. No such thing is available for clean and waste water. Consumers are stuck with the supplier for their region and cannot influence the price they pay.

attributes.action: NHS doctors should not be allowed to charge fees for care home visits
attributes.background: NHS doctors should not be allowed charge extra fees for care home visits.Currently some practices are charging care homes circa £100,00 per year as a retainer.The elderly have, generally, paid into the national health service all of their lives and now in their old age are being penalised.

attributes.action: Plase let Second generations born outside the UK have British Citizenship.
attributes.background: Britain only lets first generations born outside the UK have citizenship. At least one more generation should be elegible like in other countries.
attributes.additional_details: Let a second generation be born outside the UK like when act 1981 was made for first generations by descent.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for children to be unloaded from a vehicle in to the roadway
attributes.background: On my way to work I often see parents unloading their toddlers and children on to the roadway. It would not take much for a child to end up being injured by a passing car. I think children should be unloaded on the kerbside for their own safety.

attributes.action: Make full home inspection surveys mandatory on purchases -'buyer beware' caveat
attributes.background: 4 in 5 home buyers do not bother with full structual surveys.  This can often lead to thousands in repairs and structural work which can put enormous strain on families.  A mandatory home survey system similar to Scotland home report is needed to protect buyers and save families misery of repairs.
attributes.additional_details: Not enough guidance is issued to buyers from banks and/or estate agents about the sheer importance of buying a property without a full survey. A law change is needed to make it mandatory that full structural surveys are conducted prior to purchases either from the buyer or similar to Scotland Home report; from the seller

attributes.action: Increase the UK's military response against ISIS
attributes.background: The UK has been a part of a US-led coalition against ISIS for nearly two years. In that time period terrorist attacks around the world and against our allies have increased dramatically. We must increase our military efforts to ensure our safety and the safety of our allies by destroying ISIS.
attributes.additional_details: The death toll from ISIS terrorist attacks was 9 in 2013, increased to 1,020 in 2015 and is currently at 840 in 2016 after the horrific attack in Nice. The numbers of attacks continue to increase and ISIS continue to target some of our greatest allies such as Belgium, France and the United States. We must increase our efforts against ISIS to ensure that we are safe from terrorist attacks and to ensure the freedoms we hold so dear are protected.

attributes.action: To force all large retail outlets to buy British produce first at a fair price
attributes.background: With more and more produce available in the UK, why do we need to import 100's of tons of fruit and veg. I don't mind buying wonky carrots or odd shape veg, as long as it supports our farming/fishing industry. We need to support our own producers first.

attributes.action: Amend the Harassment Act 1997 to stop criminalisation of those with disabilities
attributes.background: The clauses that were inserted into the amended version of the act has resulted in individuals that lack social understanding/capacity due to a disability being criminalised under this law reform. The act states that a person ‘ought to know their actions amounted to harassment of another’.
attributes.additional_details:
Individuals with these types of conditions lack social understanding. 
There needs to be an alternative to criminalising these individuals.

‘It costs £65,000 to process an individual through the criminal justice system.  According to the Focus Prisoner Education website, ‘prisoners with health conditions cost more on top of that standard figure to accommodate in prison’ (Focus Prisoner Education, 2015, http://www.fpe.org.uk).

attributes.action: Amend Fixed-Term Parliaments Act to require a General Election if the PM resigns
attributes.background: When voting during a General Election, it is likely voters base their decision not only on who they want to represent them locally, but also who they would like to represent the country on the global stage. If the PM resigns, the public should get to vote again based on the new leadership.
attributes.additional_details:
Why the resignation comes about is irrelevant - this is NOT to do with the current Brexit issue.

This is NOT a request for a GE based purely on the outcome of the referendum (and so is vastly different to petition 133548), but for a change in the law to cover scenarios whereby the PM chooses to resign during a fixed term parliament. 

The public should get to choose the new Prime Minister, knowing who it is that's going to lead the country for the next 5 years, not just the members of a party.

attributes.action: Refuse entry to the refugees currently held up in Calais camps when they close
attributes.background:
There are currently over 5000 refugees camping at Calais. Natacha Bouchart plans to demolish these camps and send these people to the UK. She says this will happen "very soon". 
Our country is not capable of such numbers nor are we a soft touch.
This is not our problem.
attributes.additional_details:
Read the story here about the impending demolishing of the camps. 
http://www.mirror.co.uk/news/uk-news/calais-mayor-says-brexit-means-8408236?utm_content=buffercbf60&utm_medium=social&utm_source=facebook.com&utm_campaign=buffer

attributes.action: Relax immigration rules for elderly/disabled parents of British Citizens
attributes.background: my parents are in india. my father has been heart patient & had stroke last week and consequently become paralysis. my mother has been getting treatment of broken hips and can't look after my father.
attributes.additional_details: my parents are in india. my father has been heart patient & had stroke last week and consequently become paralysis. my mother has been getting treatment of broken hips and can't look after my father. I am married with 2 school attendee children in UK hence very stressful & difficult situation for me to go back India to look after my parents. Please allow me to bring my parents here in UK.

attributes.action: Reintroduce the dredging of rivers to reduce flooding risk...
attributes.background: The EU directive effectively stopped rivers being dredged causing flash flooding because of the reduced capacity of rivers and their inability to contain run off. Now we are no longer at the behest of the EU we can reintroduce this effective means of flood control...

attributes.action: Introduce better benefits for stay at home parents.
attributes.background: Child care is very expensive which means some parents decided to live off one wage and have a stay at home Mum or Dad for their child. I feel that there is not enough financial help from the government for stay at home parents.Sometimes the wage of one isn't enough.

attributes.action: There needs to be a cull of seagulls in Britain
attributes.background: The seagull menace in Dundee and Angus has become to much for the residents to bear and we request a cull. We also believe this to be a nationwide problem and believe most coastal towns at least would support this cull.
attributes.additional_details: We are sick of the noise pollution, attacks, destruction, etc etc and call on this Government to act

attributes.action: Use £23.4 billion  Trident costs to feed, protect and educate our children.
attributes.background: Every year the poorest people in Britain are asked to support other poor people by donating to children in need etc.  We ask that the money for Trident be spent to protect vulnerable children and that those who want Trident hold a telethon to raise money for it.
attributes.additional_details: People of all ages, but especially children are suffering and living in unacceptable poverty whilst hard working tax payers watch their money being spent on weapons of mass destruction that aren't wanted and will never be used.  This must change.

attributes.action: Make relevant work experience mandatory for students doing University courses.
attributes.background: I have found many Graduates I know who are unable to secure themselves job roles due to lack of experience. Also according to The Guardian in 2013, almost half of the Graduates are jobless. They are rejected due to the fact that they do not have 1 year experience. Exception is for those who have it.
attributes.additional_details:
A source for my claim is shown below: https://www.theguardian.com/business/2013/nov/19/half-recent-uk-graduates-stuck-jobs-ons

By making gaining work experience proposal mandatory, economy may boost. Less JSA claimants. Less students debts. The list goes on. It usually takes years and I mean years for Graduates to secure their relevant job roles due to lack of experience. Yes, you may say that they can do work experience while searching but that's not always the case due to lack of finance.

attributes.action: Final Leader elections in Government or Opposition should be by national vote.
attributes.background: Parlimentary leadership elections are decided by a small fraction of the electorate. This could see a vastly different Prime Minister or leader of the Opposition than the electorate intended to put in power and could in instances give rise to instability at a time when greater stability is required.

attributes.action: Ban HGV's from the outside lane.
attributes.background: Heavy goods vehicles in the outside lane are a danger to other road users as well as causing huge backlogs of traffic while they attempt overtaking moves at little more than the speed of the vehicle in the inside lane.Cars only in the outside lane please
attributes.additional_details: Last week when leaving Felixstowe docks on the A14 I followed a heavy goods vehicle for 15 miles in the outside lane while they attempted to overtake another HGV which was in the inside lane. A huge queue of cars had built up behind me as the trucks rolled on side by side at virtually identical speed. Very frustrating for other motorists and also dangerous. These heavy vehicles with restricted speed limit should stay in the inside lane at all times

attributes.action: Any decision which may lead to significant changes must be agreed by parliament.
attributes.background: Recently we have heard a lot of differing opinions on the actioning of article 50 of the EU charter. This petition is so that any major changes to the UK must be debated in the Commons & agreed to by parliamentary vote.
attributes.additional_details:
Recently we have heard a lot of differing opinions on the actioning of article 50 of the EU charter. 
As we know there was a referendum with a narrow margin in favour of leaving the EU. However given the imperfection information provided by both campaign the final decision should be debated by the Commons and voted on by this elected parliament to ensure the best outcome for all. Any major decisions regarding the future of the United Kingdom made in the UK should be debated and agreed upon by parliament who hold sovereignty. Any executive power held by the Prime Minister derived from the crown should be held to a minimum.

attributes.action: Establish an electoral system that requires an MP to receive 50% +1 of  turnout.
attributes.background: The UK electorate like to have an individual to vote for and be accountable. The current system allows an MP to take up a seat when the majority of constituents vote against them. Rendering them unaccountable.

attributes.action: Make It Complusory For Every Biker To Have A Helmet Cam!
attributes.background: Loosing somebody that is close to you is never easy. Epecially when it may seem like you don't have any closure to what happened to them. I think that it ALL bikers should wear helmet cams so should the worst happen to them the family can be justified and it could also make the inquest easier.

attributes.action: A call for direct use of the military in Libya
attributes.background: The civil war in Libya is awful and needs to be stopped as it is allowing jihadist groups to gain control over the North of Africa, i believe we should but an end to this war with direct force

attributes.action: Only allow the UK to go to war after allowing the citizens to vote Yes or No.
attributes.background: The decision to go to war should not rest in the hands of the politicians. We voted them in to act in our best interests but it is obvious this is not the case. Going to war costs a massive amount of money, time and lives. We should protect our country from invasion. Not invade others.
attributes.additional_details: The Chilcot Inquiry

attributes.action: We should have a cross party coalition to negotiate our exit from the EU.
attributes.background:
Our exit from the EU should be negotiated with at least two members from the Brexit camp.
This isn't just a petition aimed at people who voted Leave, these negotiations affect all of us, so please sign this petition and let's get the right people in the negotiations to get the right deal for us!

attributes.action: Declare Richmond park in London, car free Zone
attributes.background:
One of the very few places in London, where Londoners and visitors can enjoy, walking, cycling and generally being close to nature without having to leave London. 

The experience, however, is very much spoiled by increased risk of accidents due to huge number of cars driving around the park.
attributes.additional_details: Declare Richmond park in London, car free Zone. If this is not possible, the park should be car-free at the weekends.

attributes.action: Pass a law to allow left turns on a red light.
attributes.background: Will reduce traffic congestion and pollution from stationary traffic waiting to turn left at a red light... This road traffic law is legal in many other countries, lets introduce here in the UK...

attributes.action: Abolish Sunday trading laws.
attributes.background: Scotland has abolished them, so why can't we!

attributes.action: to make telling jokes about child abuse illegal
attributes.background: i feel that people will tell child abuse jokes and think its funny and fine i strongly disagree with this going back decades,, protesting on building sites etc,,, before social media
attributes.additional_details: a guy was telling a michael jackson joke back in the mid nineties on a building site,, i said sorry mate don't like those kind of jokes,,, not fair on children,, him and i went toe to toe,, i didn't mind it seems many jokes about adults,, are offensive and wrong but jokes so called about children are fine,,, this is totally wrong,, totally

attributes.action: Conduct an Independence referendum for Scotland,Wales and Northern Ireland
attributes.background: We the people living in the UK under HM's government rule after voting on EU regarding referendum demand an Independence referendum for the states of Wales,Scotland and Northern Ireland.People should have the right of such a referendum because after Brexit vote opinions of people are changed.

attributes.action: No free bus passes,tv licences for people holding over 100k in account.
attributes.background: Not fair lot of millionaires in uk can afford it and they still get all these benefits.

attributes.action: Cap private renting to affordable prices for working families
attributes.background: Private renting in the UK is at an all time high increased far more than wages and families are struggling to make ends meet because of over priced private properties to rent. The government should set out new legislation for landlords to abide by.

attributes.action: Make CBD available on the NHS to children suffering dravet syndrome.
attributes.background: Dravet syndrome is a severe and intractable epilepsy. there is a growing interest among families, physicians and the medical community in the use of cannabidiol (CBD) for the treatment of Dravet syndrome. CBD is one of more than 60 cannabinoids in the marijuana plant. CBD is not psychoactive.

attributes.action: Make Slurry Tanks safer, an  alarm should sound & also inform authorities.
attributes.background: Slurry is a mixture of manure and water. Waste from animals are stored  during the winter when cattle are kept indoors, to be spread during the warmer months. It has to be broken up & mixed, to be spread. At the mixing stage the odourless & invisible gases are produced that can kill within seconds.
attributes.additional_details:
There is no such thing as a safe slurry tank. Gases are produced by bacteria during the decomposition of slurry, these can kill instantly. The gas settles in a cloud over the top of the slurry during mixing. 

It stays in these tanks maybe for a number of months and a lethal combination of gases build up, including methane, carbon dioxide, ammonia, and worst of all, probably, hydrogen sulphide.

attributes.action: Ensure the Health Secretary is a qualified doctor of medicine.
attributes.background: The current health secretary has no medical experience, which is illogical with regards to the responsibility involved in such a job. He is also known to have supported medical practices with no scientific basis. This highlights clear problems with the way in which the health secretary is appointed.

attributes.action: Move Cannabis to Class C and move it from a schedule 1 drug
attributes.background: Both of the current class and scheduling of cannabis are out of date, unscientific, completely against all evidence, have created enormous harm to society and has held back medical advances for over 45 years.
attributes.additional_details: The reclassification of cannabis from Class C to Class B was done as part of a deal made by Gordon Brown and the Daily Mail editor. This was done against the findings, research and recommendation of the ACMD. The schedule 1 status means that the drug has no medical value. This is completely wrong as it was still being prescribed as a medicine in the UK until 1971. Over the last 20 years there have been on average 2 published studies per day on medical cannabis. People are suffering as a result.

attributes.action: Make panel van speed limits the same as cars.
attributes.background:
Speed limit for vans on an A road is 50mph - the same as a lorry.
This was set in 1982 when vans did not have disc brakes, ABS, etc.
An increase to 60mph would help with traffic flow and stop dangerous overtaking of vans.

attributes.action: Provide visas for 1st degree relatives of international students for graduation
attributes.background: International students are expected to pay university fees far in excess of their British counterparts and therefore pay much more towards improving and maintaining the universities. Sadly, we often turn our backs on these people by refusing their family visas to attend their graduation.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for schools to teach all kinds of religion in schools equally
attributes.background: Schools are currently teaching religious studies or religious education to our children which is heavily based on Christianity. If it was compulsory to teach all religions and cultures our kids would have more understanding and be more accepting to people with different beliefs reducing segregation.
attributes.additional_details: Recent political movements have lead to a 52 percent rise in race related reports. I believe this starts at home and in school. If we educate our children in school about every religion we can they will develops educated views and become more tolerant and accepting of others. This is so very important to our multi cultural society and progression as humans that we need to get this movement to change the way we teach.

attributes.action: Stop night time road closures which is costing haulage companies millions
attributes.background: Road closures during the night are costing lorry drivers millions in lost time and fuel. The diversions off of some motorways can add an hour on to a journey. It seems like the highways agency find it easier to close a road rather put a contaflow in place.

attributes.action: Give all UK Residents with NI number a vote. No taxation without representation.
attributes.background:
At 16 someone can legally leave school, get a job and pay tax. But they are denied a vote in General Elections on how that tax is spent.

The same is true for hard-working UK residents without UK citizenship. 

To address this iniquity give everyone with a National Insurance number a vote.
attributes.additional_details:
Current eligibility rules for voting in General Election (Electoral Commission)
http://www.electoralcommission.org.uk/i-am-a/voter/registering-to-vote-and-the-electoral-register

Current eligibility rules for National Insurance number (HMRC)
https://www.gov.uk/apply-national-insurance-number

attributes.action: Stop parties from supplying 'helpful' questions to ask the PM.
attributes.background: The party in power circulates 'helpful' questions to ask the PM during PM's questions. The number of questions allowed to be asked is limited, therefore these 'helpful' questions are being asked instead of Mp's asking important constituency and national matters.
attributes.additional_details:
Inside the Commons 2015 Season 1 Episode 1 shows this point perfectly and the times stated below explains exactly what we need to stop to allow more important issues being brought up during PMQ's.

Yet another reason why the public feel so wary of politicians, they are constantly wasting time and squandering the chance to reply to real topics, purely for self-gratification.

40:33 - 43:55
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Bnq2cY299xs

attributes.action: Make free healthcare at the point of service a human right
attributes.background: One of the pieces of legislation of the current government is introducing a British bill of rights. The purpose of this petition is for one of those rights to be the right to free healthcare at the point of use.
attributes.additional_details: The purpose of this is to protect the NHS and prevent the privatization of our health service.

attributes.action: We in uk deserves a tax threshold raise from 11k to 68k whatever the income.
attributes.background: We don't mind paying tax. Just don't tax us before the 68k income limit PA. Sign this people it will help everyone.

attributes.action: Increase the Council Tax band values for England to acceptable & relevant levels
attributes.background:
Council Tax valuations are based on the value of properties.

The value is the price the property would have sold for on the open market on 1 April 1991 in England and 1 April 2003 in Wales. Properties were put into a band based on their value on those dates.
attributes.additional_details:
Current Council Tax bands in England (1 April 1991 values)
Band / Value
A	up to £40,000 
B	£40,001 to £52,000
C	£52,001 to £68,000
D	£68,001 to £88,000
E	£88,001 to £120,000
F	£120,001 to £160,000
G	£160,001 to £320,000
H	more than £320,000

https://www.gov.uk

The bands were set in 1991 when house prices were 1/4 of today's value.  Anyone moving house today unfairly falls in to band F,G or H and pays between £2400-£3600 in Tax. The Values/Band should now be quadrupled in line with house prices.
